entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is described as looking into Snape's pale face and speaking in first person, indicating that he is experiencing a vision or possession.

entities.name: snape
entities.description: Snape is described as having dark eyes fixed upon the coiling serpent in its protective sphere, suggesting that he is under some sort of spell or trance.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is mentioned as the target of Voldemort's wands and the reason for their failure.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as the previous master of the Elder Wand, which was taken from his grave by Voldemort.

entities.name: lucius
entities.description: Lucius is mentioned as the owner of a wand that shattered upon meeting Harry Potter's.

entities.name: olivander
entities.description: Ollivander is mentioned as telling Voldemort about the twin cores and advising him to take another's wand under torture.

entities.name: elder wand
entities.description: The Elder Wand is described as the Wand of Destiny, the Deathstick, and is sought by Voldemort after his previous wands failed.

relationships.description: Voldemort experiences a vision or possession of Snape's face, allowing him to speak through Snape.
Voldemort takes the Elder Wand from its previous master, Dumbledore.
Snape's dark eyes are fixed upon the coiling serpent in its protective sphere.
Voldemort takes Lucius's wand, which shatters upon meeting Harry Potter's.
Voldemort takes the Elder Wand from Dumbledore's grave.
